techmeme.title: Atos says a consortium led by its largest shareholder Onepoint has withdrawn from bail-out talks and that EPEI has expressed interest in restarting discussions (Benoit Berthelot/Bloomberg)
How Google and others have carefully rewritten their terms and conditions to include words like AI, as tech companies look to train their AI models on user data (Eli Tan/New York Times)
Advantest CEO Douglas Lefever, whose company has a 54% share of the chip testing equipment market, says China will remain an important market despite US curbs (Bloomberg)
BCG, McKinsey, KPMG, and other consultants see rising demand for AI advisory services; BCG earns 20% of its revenue from AI-related work vs. 0% two years ago (Tripp Mickle/New York Times)
In a rare admission of ad fraud, Yahoo Japan to waive $189M ad revenue, or ~1.6% of parent company LY Corp's FY 2023 revenue, after detecting fraudulent clicks (Laura Dobberstein/The Register)
